title: Roasted Lemon Garlic Herb Shrimp
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Roasted Lemon Garlic Herb Shrimp a try. This dairy free and pescatarian recipe serves 3 and costs $3.76 per serving. One portion of this dish contains around 39g of protein, 27g of fat, and a total of 581 calories. 656 people found this recipe to be flavorful and satisfying. A mixture of olive oil, kosher salt and pepper, lemon zest, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so scrumptious. To use up the lemon zest you could follow this main course with the Orange Marmalade Cookies with Orange Zest Icing as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 12 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 90%. This score is amazing. Try Roasted Lemon Garlic Herb Shrimp, Roasted Lemon Garlic Herb Shrimp, and Lemon Garlic Herb Shrimp in Packets for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc are great choices for Shrimp. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. One wine you could try is Santa Margherita Pinot Grigio. It has 4.5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 26 dollars.

productMatches.title: Santa Margherita Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: A pale straw yellow. Clean, crisp fragrance with intense yet elegant hints of quince. Fresh, harmonious fruit set off by slight sweetness with a long finish full of delicate, tangy flavor.
